article_text:
A brutal winter season is blowing budgets for snow removal in many cities, but it has been a boon for some businesses.

"Yes, yes, yes," said Angie Nelson, owner of JN Firewood in Fort Ripley, Minn., referring to the increased demand for firewood. Sales, typically at 3,500 cords of wood for the season, are up to about 4,000 cords so far this year. "We are way above our average sales for the wintertime," she...

twitter.title: Hard Winter's Mixed Blessing
